{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.05971v1", "title": "Transient population dynamics of nanoparticles during pulsed EUV
  exposures", "summary": "The transient population dynamics of charged (postive or negative) and
neutral nanoparticles have been investigated in a pulsed Extreme Ultra-Violet
(EUV) exposure environment with 3DPIC simulations. At the initial stage of the
simulation, all the particles are kept neutral. As the number of EUV pulses
increases over time, the population of neutral particle decreases faster at the
expense of negatively charged particle generation outside the beam location.
However, a small population (< 1%) of neutral particles become positively
charged due to EUV photon interaction within the beam area and remains in
steady state over time. The critical pulse numbers have been estimated for
different nanometer size particles above which most of the particles outside
the beam locations become negatively charged: smaller is the particle size,
larger is the critical pulse number.", "main_category": "physics.plasm-ph", "categories": "physics.plasm-ph", "published": "2025-04-08T12:28:28Z"}
